snippet: A growing slice of the population is slipping through Europe’s long-vaunted social safety net.
abstract: Hundreds of thousands of people in France and across the European Union, trapped in low-paying or temporary jobs that are replacing the permanent jobs destroyed in Europe's economic downturn, are living in campgrounds, vehicles and cheap hotels, unable to afford the basic cost of living; economists, officials and watchdog groups warn the situation is set to worsen.

byline.contributor: Maïa de le Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A growing slice of the population is slipping through Europe’s long-vaunted social safety net.

headline.seo: In Rich Europe, Growing Ranks of Working Poor
headline.main: Ranks of Working Poor Grow in Europe
headline.print_headline: Ranks of Working Poor Grow in Europe
